doc.wiki: The philosophy of information (PI) is a branch of philosophy that studies topics relevant to computer science, information science and information technology. It includes: The philosophy of information (PI) has evolved from the philosophy of artificial intelligence, logic of information, cybernetics, social theory, ethics and the study of language and information. The logic of information, also known as the logical theory of information, considers the information content of logical signs and expressions along the lines initially developed by Charles Sanders Peirce.
